results.title: Razorback
results.creator_credit: Russell Mulcahy, Hal McElroy, Western and UAA Films
results.brief_description: Story of a female animal rights campaigner who vanishes in the outback. Her husband sets out to find her, coming up against a monstrous wild boar that’s terrorising the countryside. Stars Gregory Harrison and Arkie Whiteley with Bill Kerr, Chris Haywood and Judy Morris.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Russell Mulcahy, Hal McElroy, Western and UAA Films
results.description:
Pitched as ‘Jaws on trotters’, this creature feature rises above its B-grade premise of a killer pig thanks to American ex-pat screenwriter Everett De Roche’s script and Russel Mulcahy’s distinct, music video style.

When a movie opens with world-weary grandfather Jake (Bill Kerr) putting his grandson to bed only to have the pig burst into the house and drag the child off into the night, you know you’re in for a trip. With shades of the Lindy Chamberlain case, Jake goes to trial but is acquitted for the child’s death. In the community’s eyes, he remains suspicious. While he searches for the boar that gorged his grandson, American traveller Carl (Gregory Harrison) searches for his missing girlfriend, a wildlife reporter who’s met a grisly fate at both the hands of a man and tusks of the eponymous pig.

While the storyline may not be the most sophisticated, the film is lauded for its visual flare and uncanny environment. As The New York Times notes, “the landscapes… have a wonderfully bizarre, almost Dali-esque character. This is a place where the full moon never wanes…”

Likewise, the limitations imposed by the quality of the animatronic boar also inform the optic amazement. Though it cost $250,000 to make, Razorback doesn’t look that great, so Mulcahy treats the creature much like Spielberg does his great white – it’s rarely seen.

The Guardian’s Luke Buckmaster considers the limitation a boon. “The director took on the challenge with gusto, creating a berserk aesthetic infused with POV shots, busy backgrounds, images graded with extreme colour and shadows and mega close-ups of the creature’s tusks and mouth. Razorback is a work of gut-busting visual bravado.”

Not bad praise for the man who directed Bonnie Tyler’s ‘Total Eclipse of the Heart’.

Rusell Mulcahy also holds the honour of being the director of the first video clip to ever appear on MTV.

results.title: Tim
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Colleen McCullough this is the story of an affair between an older woman and a young intellectually disabled man she meets when he becomes her gardener. Starring Piper Laurie and Mel Gibson.
results.description: Based on the novel by Colleen McCullough this is the story of an affair between an older woman and a young intellectually disabled man she meets when he becomes her gardener. Starring Piper Laurie and Mel Gibson.
description_for_label: Based on the novel by Colleen McCullough this is the story of an affair between an older woman and a young intellectually disabled man she meets when he becomes her gardener. Starring Piper Laurie and Mel Gibson.

results.title: The Earthling
results.creator_credit: Peter Collinson, John Strong, Elliot Schick and Samuel Z Arkoff
results.brief_description: Patrick Foley, dying presumably of cancer, returns from America to his outback country town. There, after the briefest of conversations with long-lost acquaintances, he sets off over the mountains to a remote and hidden valley where his father once carved out a small farm. On his way, he comes accross Shawn Daley, who has just seen his mother and father die in a campervan accident. Lost, angry and afraid, Shawn seeks Patrick’s help but is coldly rebuffed. The irascible Patrick wants nothing to do with anybody else and tells the boy he must fend for himself. Shawn has no choice but to keep hounding Patrick, and the rest of the film is the changing relationship between this dying man and a dependent child. Cast includes William Holden, Ricky Schroder, Jack Thompson and Olivia Hamnett.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Collinson, John Strong, Elliot Schick and Samuel Z Arkoff

results.title: Summer City
results.creator_credit: Christopher Fraser, Phil Avalon and Summer City Productions
results.brief_description: Set in the early 1960’s, four young men take off for a weekend fling in search of girls, surf, and thrills, but encounter fear and death. Stars Mel Gibson, Steve Bisley, John Jarratt and Abigail.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher Fraser, Phil Avalon and Summer City Productions

results.title: The Wild Duck
results.creator_credit: Henri Safran, Phillip Emanuel and Film Bancor of Aust
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Henrik Ibsen about the fortunes of a loving family - the ineffectual loving father whose pride and dreams conceal a life of poverty and failure, his practical wife and their beautiful and faithful young daughter. The family is broken apart when deceived by the misplaced idealism of another person. Stars Liv Ullman and Jeremy Irons.

results.title: Windrider
results.creator_credit: Vincent Monton, Paul D. Barron and Barron Films
results.brief_description: A windsurfer becomes obsessed with a woman who has been watching him surf. He undertakes a comical and unrelenting search for her which eventually wears down his resistance. Underlying his passion for her is the windsurfers’ determination to win the World Classic Windsurfing Championships for which he is preparing an unbeatable windsurfing rig. Stars Tom Burlinson and Nicole Kidman with Jill Perryman and Charles Tingwell.

results.title: Dogs in Space
results.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, Richard Lowenstein, Glenys Rowe, Burrowes Film Group and Entertainment Media
results.brief_description: Young people enjoy the summer of 1979 in the belief that they will never grow up and join the adult world. Action centres on a Melbourne household of punks, hippies, students and radicals who represent the counter culture and the punk generation.

constellations_other.name: Black Power through film and TV
constellations_other.description: The Black Power movement of the late 1960s and early 70s was “the most exciting and dynamic era in modern Indigenous history” according to Aboriginal activist Professor Gary Foley, who gained widespread attention for protests during the time and later leveraged film and TV to fight for Indigenous rights.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jill Bilcock, Richard Lowenstein, Glenys Rowe, Burrowes Film Group and Entertainment Media
results.description: A group of young people enjoy the summer of 1979 in the belief that they will never grow up and join the adult world. Action centres on a Melbourne household of punks, hippies, students and radicals who represent the counter culture and the punk generation living on sex, drugs, rock ‘n’ roll and television. Stars Michael Hutchence of INXS.

results.title: The Time guardian
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Robert Lagettie, Norm Wilkinson, Chateau Productions Investments and International Film Management
results.brief_description: During the 24th Century a new city is launched into time to escape a polluted and dying earth. It must keep travelling to avoid the Jen-Diki, mutated descendants of the people they once were and the city’s natural enemy. After yet another attack, the city is forced to repair and recharge in a safe year and comes to rest in the 20th Century. Stars Tom Burlinson, Carrie Fisher, Dean Stockwell and Nikki Coghill.

results.title: With Love to the Person Next to Me
results.creator_credit: Brian McKenzie, John Cruthers and Standard Films
results.brief_description: A comical study in urban alienation and taxi etiquette. Wallace is a taxi driver who lives in a St. Kilda flat with a cast of walking wounded neighbours, all of whom are chronically disconnected like him. He drives the cab at night and spends his days making cider and listening to tapes of the conversations he records secretly in the cab. Those tapes are his only real contact with the world and they allow Wallace to connect with other people’s misery. Cast includes Kim Gyngell, Sally McKenzie, Paul Chubb, Barry Dickens and Daniel Scharf

results.title: Iceman
results.creator_credit: Fred Schepisi, Norman Jewison, Patrick Palmer and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Drama about a team of Arctic researchers who find a 40,000 year old man frozen in ice and bring him back to life. The anthropologist wants to befriend him and learn about man’s past while the medical researchers want to discover the secret that will allow man to live in a frozen state. Stars Timothy Hutton, John Lone and Lindsay Crouse.
